content:
• Friday, August 10, 2012
  • MANU

    Recent IPO Manchester United (NYSE:MANU) continues to strugge after a lackluster debut. The...

    Recent IPO Manchester United (NYSE:MANU) continues to strugge after a lackluster debut. The shares finally broke their initial $14 offering price in after hours trading today, briefly hitting a low of $13.90 before recovering. During the regular session the stock traded at or above its $14 offering price, which had already been reduced from the originally planned range of $16 to $20.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:05 PM | 6 Comments
  • NFLX

    Capital Research Global Investors discloses it owned a 10.5% stake in Netflix (NFLX +3.4%) as of...

    Capital Research Global Investors discloses it owned a 10.5% stake in Netflix (NFLX +3.4%) as of July 31. CRGI, a Capital Group division, isn't typically an activist investor.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM | 10 Comments
  • PGHEF

    Pengrowth Energy Trust (PGH): declares $0.04/share monthly dividend, in line with previous....

    Pengrowth Energy Trust (PGH): declares $0.04/share monthly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 6.99%. For shareholders of record Aug 22. Payable Sep 17. Ex-div date Aug 20. Shares -1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 4 Comments
  • ATPAQ

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG) files to delay its 10-Q due to the inability to file without...

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG) files to delay its 10-Q due to the inability to file without unreasonable effort and expense. Reports of a pending bankruptcy by the company surfaced earlier today, when the stock was halted over headlines that the oil exploration company had arranged debtor-in-possesion financing.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM | 2 Comments
  • DK

    Delek US Holdings (DK -11.7%) ended the week nearly 30% higher despite giving up a chunk of...

    Delek US Holdings (DK -11.7%) ended the week nearly 30% higher despite giving up a chunk of those gains today. DK earlier reported higher Q2 profits, with volumes boosted by the addition of rail service to its El Dorado refinery in Arkansas; crude oil volume delivered by rail rose from 2K bbl/day in April to ~9K in July. Credit Suisse raises its target price to $29 from $24, as well as 2013 EPS estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • BB

    Though Research In Motion (RIMM +6.3%) bounced on a report IBM is interested in its data...

    Though Research In Motion (RIMM +6.3%) bounced on a report IBM is interested in its data services arm, many are skeptical RIM, which reportedly wants to wait until BB10 ships before making sale decisions, will agree to unload the business, estimated to be worth $2B (~$4/share) by some. "It would be like removing one of your most important organs," says a Frost & Sullivan analyst. Fair enough, but how much is the rest of the body worth at this point? Update: The WSJ reports RIM is looking to sell its NewBay mobile content unit, acquired last year for $100M. Chances are they'll take a loss.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 6 Comments
  • SMG

    Scotts Miracle-Gro (SMG +3.8%) gives an update on Q4 EPS guidance, saying it mistakenly stated...

    Scotts Miracle-Gro (SMG +3.8%) gives an update on Q4 EPS guidance, saying it mistakenly stated an expected loss in Q4 of around $0.40. To clarify, the company anticipates an operating loss in the Q4 which will translate into an adjusted loss per share closer to $0.60. Street EPS consensus expectations are at $0.44.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • HAR

    Harman International (HAR +7.6%) moves higher today after its Q4 easily beat bottom line...

    Harman International (HAR +7.6%) moves higher today after its Q4 easily beat bottom line estimates. Net earnings more than doubled, growing for the 11th consecutive quarter, on a jump in sales. Top-line growth benefited from the company's aggressive expansion into emerging markets, plus an overall recovery in consumer in and automotive spending.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • EPAY

    Bottomline Technologies (EPAY +20.2%) tops today's leader board as FQ4 results beat estimates on...

    Bottomline Technologies (EPAY +20.2%) tops today's leader board as FQ4 results beat estimates on a surge in subscriptions and transactions, which grew 54% Y/Y. Craig-Hallum upgrades the stock on what it calls a "fairly impressive quarter" to Buy from Hold and raises its price target to $26 from $20.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +9.8%), crushed on Tuesday thanks to a poor Q2 report, is rallying for the...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +9.8%), crushed on Tuesday thanks to a poor Q2 report, is rallying for the second day in a row. Today's culprit is a Bloomberg column speculating on M&A interest, given recent management comments suggesting a willingness to sell. The column notes a Pivotal Research analyst estimates Leap's spectrum and operations could be worth $16/share to a buyer. 45% of Leap's float was shorted as of July 13. MetroPCS (PCS +2.2%) has also been the subject of M&A rumors.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • ADM

    After corn prices spiked to new highs following today's USDA report, prices ended lower as cuts...

    After corn prices spiked to new highs following today's USDA report, prices ended lower as cuts to demand estimates helped offset the expected declines in corn yields. "The USDA is behind the market and [traders] expect another reduction in yield," a pro says. Food shares are mixed: ADM -2%, HRL +0.1%, HSH -1.8%, TSN +1.3%, MON -2.1%, POT +0.8%, CF -2.1%, AGU -0.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • GFA-OLD

    Brazilian real-estate developer Gafisa (GFA-OLD +13.6%) ramps higher after swinging a profit in...

    Brazilian real-estate developer Gafisa (GFA-OLD +13.6%) ramps higher after swinging a profit in Q2 and putting an end to the streak of losses in the previous quarters, as it reduced expenses by cutting the volume of new project launches and slashing costs. Since last year the company has been restructuring its subsidiaries, mainly Tenda, which it acquired at the end of 2008. However, the acquisition hasn't paid off and has been a considerable drain on operating costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake (CHK -3.8%) shares slide a day after after the company disclosed it has received a...

    Chesapeake (CHK -3.8%) shares slide a day after after the company disclosed it has received a Justice Department subpoena related to land deals it made in Michigan. Four days before the government asked for documents, Reuters reported CHK colluded with Encana (ECA -0.2%) to suppress land prices in areas considered rich in oil and natural gas.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM | 3 Comments

  • Off 2.2% today in the wake of a crop report confirming what everybody already knew (a very short...

    Off 2.2% today in the wake of a crop report confirming what everybody already knew (a very short crop), corn may also be fading on a rumor the White House could be open to waving the ethanol requirement for fuel.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 4 Comments
  • SGNT

    Wall Street firms are responding today to Sagent Pharmaceuticals' (SGNT -2.6%) revised outlook...

    Wall Street firms are responding today to Sagent Pharmaceuticals' (SGNT -2.6%) revised outlook yesterday, which took the shares down over 25% during the trading session. RBC cut the shares to Sector Perform on the news, citing a lack of earnings visibility over the near term, while Needham, cut its price target to $20 from $25, saying the company "remains its own worst enemy" when it comes to managing estimates and maintaining management's credibility.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • UNG

    Natural gas continues a major reversal and wild ride, off 5.9% today after exploding higher and...

    Natural gas continues a major reversal and wild ride, off 5.9% today after exploding higher and then lower by 7% within the space of a few hours yesterday. Yesterday's move up came after bullish storage data. The sell-off? UNG -4.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • CYOU

    Sohu (SOHU -2.9%) falls on a downgrade to Neutral from UBS. Shares took off earlier this week...

    Sohu (SOHU -2.9%) falls on a downgrade to Neutral from UBS. Shares took off earlier this week after subsidiary Changyou (NASDAQ:CYOU) announced a special dividend and plans to float an IPO for its 7Road gaming division, but remain down over 50% from their 52-week high.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 4 Comments
  • AVGO

    Broadcom (BRCM +3%) is trading higher thanks to an upgrade to Outperform from Bernstein. Shares...

    Broadcom (BRCM +3%) is trading higher thanks to an upgrade to Outperform from Bernstein. Shares have been quietly rallying in recent weeks, due to optimism about a chip industry recovery and hopes that Broadcom's strong exposure (I, II) to Apple and Samsung will offset the weakness seen by other mobile customers.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • CWST

    Casella Waste (CWST -9.2%) announces a realignment of its operations to reduce costs, and lowers...

    Casella Waste (CWST -9.2%) announces a realignment of its operations to reduce costs, and lowers FY2013 revenue guidance. CWST says it continues to experience declines in special waste volumes at its western region landfills and weakness in recycling commodity pricing.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • ATPAQ

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG -52.7%) resumes trading after a brief halt stemming from...

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG -52.7%) resumes trading after a brief halt stemming from headlines that the oil explorer has arranged for a $600M debtor-in-possession loan. A filing reportedly may come as soon as today.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 2 Comments
  • MIPS

    MIPS gains 2.6% after it cancels plans to present at an upcoming conference, thereby fueling a...

    MIPS gains 2.6% after it cancels plans to present at an upcoming conference, thereby fueling a new round of buyout speculation: AMD has been named as a potential buyer (less likely now, in light of AMD's selloff), and the chip IP firm has reportedly hired Goldman to help facilitate a sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • CE

    Celanese (CE +1.6%) says a jury has ruled in its favor in a suit filed by Southern Chemical...

    Celanese (CE +1.6%) says a jury has ruled in its favor in a suit filed by Southern Chemical relating to the terms of a multi-year methanol supply contract for CE's U.S. and Mexico-based operations. The jury determined that Celanese did not violate the terms of the contract, and Southern Chemical should continue to supply methanol until its expiration.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • ATRS

    Shares of Antares Pharma (ATRS -9.1%) continue their slide today after its second-quarter loss...

    Shares of Antares Pharma (ATRS -9.1%) continue their slide today after its second-quarter loss widened and results missed analyst estimates on Wednesday. Net profit was hit by bottom line pressure from higher investment expenses related to the development of its Vibex MTX auto injector for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis, along with an increase in support personnel.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM | 9 Comments
  • DNKN

    Jennison Associates boosted its stake in Dunkin Brands (DNKN -1.6%) to 10.08%, adding close to...

    Jennison Associates boosted its stake in Dunkin Brands (DNKN -1.6%) to 10.08%, adding close to 2.38M shares during Q2 according to a filing with the SEC. (13G)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • CDXS

    Codexis (CDXS -20%) shares are crushed after the biofuels maker says in its Q2 report that it...

    Codexis (CDXS -20%) shares are crushed after the biofuels maker says in its Q2 report that it won’t receive further funding from Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A, RDS.B) for research into converting biomass to fuel. Shares are cut to Neutral from Outperform at Credit Suisse.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR -4.2%) slumps after Macquarie's Kevin Smithen downgrades to Underperform on...

    Clearwire (CLWR -4.2%) slumps after Macquarie's Kevin Smithen downgrades to Underperform on account of liquidity fears. Though patron Sprint, which needs Clearwire's spectrum, just priced a $1.5B debt offering it will use to help finance the company, Smithen doubts Clearwire can get more funding after its cash runs out in 12 months. "A debt position yielding [15 percent plus] isn't a bullish call on Clearwire equity," he adds. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 5 Comments
  • UBNT

    The bottom continues to fall out of Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT -41.5%) due to the brutal FQ1...

    The bottom continues to fall out of Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT -41.5%) due to the brutal FQ1 guidance provided with its FQ4 report.  Downgrades are pouring in: Wedbush says it underestimated the depth of Ubiquiti's problems with counterfeit goods, while Deutsche believes a saturated market for Ubiquiti's airMAX wireless transmission gear could also be responsible. Herb Greenberg must feel vindicated.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • SPPI

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI +2.4%) racks up a gain today after the company's board approved...

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI +2.4%) racks up a gain today after the company's board approved an increase in its stock repurchase program of up $100M, a significant boost from its previously authorized $25M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • CFN

    CareFusion (CFN +7%) trades up after its FQ4 beat expectations across the board late yesterday....

    CareFusion (CFN +7%) trades up after its FQ4 beat expectations across the board late yesterday. Net earnings rose 29% Y/Y despite only moderate revenue growth, as fewer restructuring and acquisition-related charges boosted the the medical-device company's bottom line.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +3.4%) and Groupon (GRPN +6.2%) are rallying strongly today; shorts may be covering...

    Facebook (FB +3.4%) and Groupon (GRPN +6.2%) are rallying strongly today; shorts may be covering ahead of the weekend. Facebook's gains come 5 days before a lock-up on 10% of outstanding shares expires. CNBC's David Faber reports the company has been meeting with institutional investors to stoke interest in shares ahead of the expiration.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 3 Comments
  • JCP

    Shares of J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) run up a 5.2% gain after Ron Johnson runs out at least a few...

    Shares of J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) run up a 5.2% gain after Ron Johnson runs out at least a few shorts with a renewed bout of confidence in an earnings CC (I, II) following another quarter with an over 20% loss in sales. In a nutshell, RJ says the company will "stay the course" - despite the revenue tailoff - and tips off that August numbers are improving. What's next: Look for another Bill Ackman defense (Ira Sohn presentation .pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 8 Comments
  • CHFS

    Sunshine Heart (SSH -16.2%) gets slammed today after initially announcing a 2.5M share secondary...

    Sunshine Heart (SSH -16.2%) gets slammed today after initially announcing a 2.5M share secondary offering , then boosting the size of the offering to just under 2.9M shares and pricing it at $7, a 15% discount to Thursday's close. The offering will bring in around $20M, which will likely be put to use in bringing to market its next-generation C-Pulse Driver, which received conditional FDA approval earlier this week.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 2 Comments
  • LVLT

    Goldman has launched coverage on Level 3 (LVLT +5.7%) and JDS Uniphase (JDSU +0.6%) with Buy...

    Goldman has launched coverage on Level 3 (LVLT +5.7%) and JDS Uniphase (JDSU +0.6%) with Buy ratings, though only the former seems to be benefiting Finisar (FNSR +0.7%) and Ciena (CIEN +0.1%) have been started at Neutral. Regarding Level 3, Goldman likes the impact of the Global Crossing acquisition on the company's balance sheet, and believes it could deliver "sustainable" free cash flow for the first time in its history.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • WEN

    Shares of Wendy's (WEN -3.5%) falter a day after a respectable earnings report. SA author Stock...

    Shares of Wendy's (WEN -3.5%) falter a day after a respectable earnings report. SA author Stock Games crunches the valuation numbers on the stock to conclude that "relatively weak" fundamentals aren't likely to support WEN's current valuations.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • TCPTF

    S&P cuts its credit rating for Thompson Creek Metals (TC -2.9%) to CCC+ from B- following...

    S&P cuts its credit rating for Thompson Creek Metals (TC -2.9%) to CCC+ from B- following TC's announcement of weaker production and cost expectations through next year. Diminishing operating margins could drain previously arranged funding sources set up to support the large capital requirements at the Mt. Milligan project.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +6.4%) pops after Piper starts coverage with an Overweight and $6 PT. The...

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +6.4%) pops after Piper starts coverage with an Overweight and $6 PT. The mobile game developer, frequently a subject of M&A speculation, had 24.7% of its float shorted as of July 13. (Q2 report)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • OSUR

    OraSure (OSUR +4.1%) moves up this morning after Jefferies initiates coverage with a Buy rating...

    OraSure (OSUR +4.1%) moves up this morning after Jefferies initiates coverage with a Buy rating and a price target of $14. Jefferies cites the revenue growth potential of its new home HIV test kit, and notes that the shares are trading at a significant discount to its projected 2013 revenue forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • CSCO

    Analysts continue to duel over Cisco (CSCO -1.5%) ahead of Wednesday's FQ4 report: a day after...

    Analysts continue to duel over Cisco (CSCO -1.5%) ahead of Wednesday's FQ4 report: a day after receiving upgrades from Piper and Goldman, Needham is starting coverage at Hold on growth worries. Others chiming in recently include Caris (Buy), Oppenheimer (Buy), and Pac Crest (Sector Perform). One general theme within the commentary is that enterprise sales are reasonably healthy given low expectations, but telecom demand is soft.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • CSOD

    Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD +15.7%) surges to new highs following its Q2 report. While results...

    Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD +15.7%) surges to new highs following its Q2 report. While results were only in-line, bookings jumped 31% Q/Q and 51% Y/Y to $31.5M, above revenue of $26.7M. Also, the cloud HR software vendor guided on its earnings call for 2012 revenue of $115.5M-$117.5M and EPS of -$0.26 to -$0.30 - the latter is in-line, but the former is above a $115.2M consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • LVS

    Las Vegas Sands (LVS -2.4%) trades lower after yet another investigation launches into the...

    Las Vegas Sands (LVS -2.4%) trades lower after yet another investigation launches into the casino operator's offshore operations. The company has been on the hot seat with Macau regulators more often than peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 2 Comments
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO) -4.2% after its 10-Q bombshell, which suggests CEO Marissa Mayer might prefer to...

    Yahoo (YHOO) -4.2% after its 10-Q bombshell, which suggests CEO Marissa Mayer might prefer to use some of the Alibaba proceeds to buy companies rather than Yahoo shares. The Street isn't pleased - BofA is downgrading to Hold - but Nicholas Carlson considers it necessary, given Yahoo's competitive woes and need for talent. He thinks popular (and richly-valued) names such as Yelp (YELP - a company Mayer wanted Google to buy), Pinterest, Quora, and Vimeo could be in play.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM | 4 Comments
  • ALT

    PharmAthene (PIP) sinking, down 15.1% premarket, as the FDA says it's put the firm's SparVax...

    PharmAthene (PIP) sinking, down 15.1% premarket, as the FDA says it's put the firm's SparVax anthrax vaccine program on clinical hold. Details to come from the agency within 30 days, but no adverse effects have been reported as the trial hadn't yet begun.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM
  • RNDY

    Shares of Roundy's (NYSE:RNDY) slip 22.5% in premarket trading after the grocery store chain...

    Shares of Roundy's (NYSE:RNDY) slip 22.5% in premarket trading after the grocery store chain misses earnings estimates by a penny in Q2 and lowers its forecast for the year. CEO Robert Mariano warns of an increasingly "price-conscious" consumer and pricing pressure in major markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • FIO

    Premarket gainers: FIO +23%. JNS +18%. XIN +14%. BYI +7%. RIMM +6%. Losers: UBNT -39%. RNDY...

    Premarket gainers: FIO +23%. JNS +18%. XIN +14%. BYI +7%. RIMM +6%.
    Losers: UBNT -39%. RNDY -22%. SPRD -13%. PIP -11%. ATRS -6%. CPST -6%. DK -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) +22.3% premarket after its 13% Q/Q jump in revenue, far ahead of the flat...

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) +22.3% premarket after its 13% Q/Q jump in revenue, far ahead of the flat growth it had told investors to expect. "We see this as fairly strong evidence that while competitors are chipping away at smaller opportunities, Fusion-io is likely winning the bigger PCIe deals," says Stifel Nicolaus, one of at least four brokerages raising price targets on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM

  • The USDA's highly anticipated crop report pegs the corn harvest at 10.779B bushels, 150M less...

    The USDA's highly anticipated crop report pegs the corn harvest at 10.779B bushels, 150M less then expected. The yield of 123.4 bushels/acre (vs. 127.4 est.) is the lowest since 1995. Ending stocks are pegged at a tiny 650M bushels, down from 1.18B. Traders sell the news, Sept. corn flat now after being a dime higher before the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • JCP

    More from the J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) earnings CC (previous): No contingency plan in place, as...

    More from the J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) earnings CC (previous): No contingency plan in place, as Ron Johnson says the company will stick with a "learn and adjust" model. CFO Ken Hannah harps on the significant SG&A expense savings amid revenue decline. Also, a shocking amount of details on the free kids haircuts the retailer is giving away. JCP now down -1.3% premarket, with possible short covering in play.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM
  • JNS

    Janus Group (NYSE:JNS) +15.7% premarket after announcing a strategic alliance with Japan's...

    Janus Group (NYSE:JNS) +15.7% premarket after announcing a strategic alliance with Japan's Dai-ichi Life Insurance allowing for purchase of as much as a 20% stake and a $2B investment of its general account assets with the firm. Following accumulation of at least 15% of JNS shares, Dai-ichi says it expects to get a seat on the firm's board.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM
  • BAM

    Brookfield Asset Management (NYSE:BAM): Q2 FFO of $0.34 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $4.29B...

    Brookfield Asset Management (NYSE:BAM): Q2 FFO of $0.34 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $4.29B (+8.32% Y/Y) misses by $430M. Shares +1.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM
  • JCP

    Ron Johnson is on the mike at the J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) earnings CC (webcast). The embattled...

    Ron Johnson is on the mike at the J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) earnings CC (webcast). The embattled exec starts with a quick admission of past mistakes and an unfortunate alienation of core customers before hitting his "transformational" stride. Despite the direction the RJ rhetoric goes, the company pulling away its guidance is going to be the headline that resonates. JCP -8.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM | 3 Comments

  • Oil futures are -1.4% after the IEA says in its monthly report that the weak global economy...

    Oil futures are -1.4% after the IEA says in its monthly report that the weak global economy could cap demand for crude, a warning that comes just as disappointing trade data from China strengthens fears about the country's growth. The IEA's report also follows OPEC warning yesterday that a "horizon full of turbulence" could hit demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • MNST

    Shares of Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) slip a bit more, now down 5.9% premarket, after the...

    Shares of Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) slip a bit more, now down 5.9% premarket, after the company discloses that an unnamed state AG is investigating its marketing practices. UBS is out with a warning that other energy drink manufacturers were named a related subpoena. On watch: COT, PEP, FIZZ.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 AM | 4 Comments
  • JCP

    As bad as lopping off over 20% from sales in Q2 may be, analysts seem to be even more shocked by...

    As bad as lopping off over 20% from sales in Q2 may be, analysts seem to be even more shocked by J.C. Penney's 33% decline in online sales. All this from a company desperately trying to recycle some of the Apple retail magic. JCP -6.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:59 AM | 3 Comments

  • Like their Asian brethren, EU stocks are lower following the rather disappointing Chinese trade...

    Like their Asian brethren, EU stocks are lower following the rather disappointing Chinese trade data. EU Stoxx 50 -0.9%, London -0.2%, Paris -0.8%, Frankfurt -0.5%, Madrid -1.5%, Milan -0.9%. U.S. Futures are also down: Dow -0.4%, S&P -0.4%, Nasdaq -0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 AM

  • Asia shares are lower following the major disappointment that is China's trade data, which, says...

    Asia shares are lower following the major disappointment that is China's trade data, which, says investment strategist Larry Jiang, "could mean China is in bigger trouble than most people think, and the uncertainty might hurt interest in stocks even more." Japan -1%, Hong Kong -0.9%, China -0.2%, India -0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 AM
